channel.title: Simple Ranks system

item.title: Simple Ranks system
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Not a tutorial, and it is also not accurate. Doing

public void doStuff(String message) {
    if (arbitraryCondition) {
        message = "blah";
    }
}

Will not change the input string outside of the method.

Read full topic

item.title: Simple Ranks system
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

You could follow this, ya know.

[quote=“Taharok, post:1, topic:265742”]When Posting a New Tutorial
When you are posting a new tutorial, be sure that it covers all of the following:

[ul][li]It shows some effort put into it – it’s your work, show some pride![/li]
[li]It’s a tutorial relevant directly to RuneScape 2 Private Servers and nothing else.[/li]
[li]Any code snippets provided have been thoroughly explained with careful detail.[/li]
[li]Make sure that the work you post is only yours, unless you have permission to post someone else’s work and accredit them appropriately. Stealing work is not tolerated here.[/li]
[li]You may post a tutorial that has already been created if and only if it surpasses any existing tutorials of its type.[/li][/ul][/quote]

item.title: Simple Ranks system
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

[code]

public static void Ranks(String Rank){ //here we made a void that basically control the system.
if(playerKills >= 10){// saying that if playerKills is more or equals to 10 the rank = rank1
Rank = “Rank1”;
}else if(playerKills >= 25){//else if the playerKills is more or equals to 25 the rank = rank2
Rank = “Rank2”;
}//Etc… add more
}[/code]
ofcurse you can change the ranks to what ever you want and add how much ranks you want.
Now basically if you have a sendQuest method add it in the Quest interface:

sendQuest("Player Rank : " +Rank, 8144); //Prints the rank in the quest interface

hope it helps.

Read full topic
